conversations.description: User uploads a single outpatient claim PDF; the assistant extracts text, parses it, validates CPT codes, and returns a correction suggestion for an unsupported modifier.
Provider submits a batch of five claim PDFs; the system processes each, flags two claims with mismatched ICD‑10 diagnoses, and suggests code adjustments.

A billing clerk asks why a claim was denied; the assistant retrieves the policy coverage for the insurer, explains the prior‑auth requirement, and recommends adding the necessary authorization number.
User wants to verify if a newly introduced HCPCS code (G0123) is covered under their AETNA Gold plan; the assistant looks up the code and policy, then displays coverage limits.
A practice manager checks the reimbursement rate for CPT 99213 under a Medicare Advantage plan; the assistant queries the policy and provides the maximum reimbursable amount.
User uploads a claim with a missing provider NPI; the assistant identifies the omission, extracts the rest of the data, and prompts the user to add the NPI before re‑submission.
A new staff member asks for a step‑by‑step walk‑through of claim processing; the assistant demonstrates extracting text, parsing, code lookup, and generating correction suggestions.
Provider questions a flagged billing error for a duplicate line item; the assistant compares line details, confirms duplication, and advises consolidation.
User wants to see a summary report of all claims flagged in the past month; the assistant aggregates correction suggestions and presents a concise dashboard.
A clinician uploads a claim using a temporary code; the assistant checks if the code is provisional, notes the need for final code conversion, and provides guidance.
Billing specialist asks whether a modifier‑25 is required for a telehealth visit; the assistant looks up the CPT description and insurer policy, then advises appropriately.
User uploads a scanned PDF with poor OCR quality; the assistant attempts extraction, alerts to low confidence, and offers to request a higher‑resolution file.
Practice wants to pre‑validate claims before submission; the assistant runs a ‘dry‑run’ check on a sample claim and lists potential denials.
User asks for a comparison of coverage between two insurers (AETNA vs. CIGNA) for CPT 71020; the assistant retrieves policy details for both and highlights differences.
Provider receives a denial for a non‑covered ICD‑10 code; the assistant explains why the code is excluded under the current plan and suggests an alternative diagnosis code.
Billing admin wants to know the required documentation for a surgical CPT 27447; the assistant queries the policy and lists needed operative reports and implant logs.
User uploads a claim where the service date precedes the patient’s eligibility start date; the assistant detects the eligibility mismatch and flags it.
A health‑system analyst requests an export of all correction suggestions in CSV format for audit purposes; the assistant compiles the data and provides a downloadable file.
Provider asks whether a specific diagnosis code requires a secondary diagnosis pairing; the assistant looks up ICD‑10 rules and insurer policy, then confirms the requirement.
User wants to understand why a claim with correct codes was still denied; the assistant reviews the claim, finds a missing prior‑auth number, and suggests adding it.
Clinic schedules a mass claim upload for end‑of‑month reconciliation; the assistant queues the PDFs, processes them, and returns a batch correction report.
Billing staff wonders if a certain HCPCS code (J3490) can be billed with a specific CPT; the assistant checks compatibility and insurer coverage rules.
User asks for a quick validation of a single line item (CPT 99214) against an updated policy version; the assistant fetches the latest policy and confirms compliance.
Provider needs guidance on using modifiers for multiple procedures performed on the same day; the assistant explains modifier‑59 usage and checks for conflicts.
User uploads a claim where the patient's gender conflicts with the diagnosis code; the assistant detects the inconsistency and recommends correction.
A medical coder requests a list of all required modifiers for a given CPT series; the assistant retrieves code details and returns the modifier list.
Practice wants to simulate a claim denial scenario to train staff; the assistant generates a fake claim with intentional errors and provides feedback.
User asks whether a new telehealth policy amendment affects existing CPT 99421 claims; the assistant reviews the amendment and advises on retroactive adjustments.
Billing manager wants to know the average turnaround time for corrected claims with a particular insurer; the assistant calculates and presents the metric.
Provider uploads a claim with an out‑of‑network provider flag; the assistant checks the plan’s out‑of‑network reimbursement rules and suggests appropriate billing.
User needs to know if a specific diagnosis code is bundled with a procedure code under Medicare; the assistant references bundling rules and informs the user.
Clinic asks for a checklist of documentation required for a high‑cost specialty drug claim; the assistant enumerates necessary forms and prior‑auth steps.
Billing staff wonders why a claim with correct codes still shows a “contractual adjustment” line; the assistant explains payer contract adjustments and how to interpret them.
User wants to verify that the patient’s policy ID matches the insurer’s database; the assistant queries the insurer’s policy records and confirms or flags mismatch.
Provider asks if a particular CPT code is considered experimental under a given plan; the assistant checks policy coverage and returns the status.
User uploads a claim where the service location code is missing; the assistant identifies the missing field and prompts for the correct location identifier.
Billing analyst needs a summary of all denied claims over the past quarter with reasons; the assistant aggregates denial codes and provides a concise report.
Clinic wants to know the maximum allowable units for a repeat therapy CPT 97001; the assistant checks policy limits and advises on unit caps.
Provider wonders whether a procedure performed on a weekend impacts reimbursement; the assistant reviews policy for weekend service differentials.
User asks for a step‑by‑step guide to resubmit a corrected claim after receiving the AI’s suggestions; the assistant outlines the resubmission workflow.
Billing team wants to confirm if a specific CPT code is covered for pediatric patients only; the assistant checks age‑specific coverage rules.
User uploads a claim with an unusually high charge amount; the assistant compares the charge to typical reimbursement rates and flags possible overbilling.
Provider needs to know if a certain diagnosis requires a specific ICD‑10 laterality indicator; the assistant looks up the code and confirms the requirement.
Clinic asks whether a bundled payment arrangement applies to a series of physiotherapy CPT codes; the assistant evaluates bundling policies and informs the user.
User wants to see how a change in policy effective date would affect future claim acceptance; the assistant simulates the policy change and predicts outcomes.
Billing staff asks why a claim shows a “duplicate billing” error; the assistant scans line items, identifies identical service dates and codes, and suggests removal of the duplicate.
Provider wants to know the required signature fields for a claim form to be considered valid; the assistant lists the mandatory signatures and their positions.
User asks for a quick validation of a claim’s total cost against the policy’s maximum yearly benefit; the assistant sums claim amounts and compares to the benefit cap.
Clinic needs to generate a letter to the insurer explaining a coding exception; the assistant drafts a concise justification letter based on policy details.
Billing manager wants to set up automatic alerts for any claim denials involving a specific high‑risk CPT code; the assistant configures a monitoring rule and previews alert samples.
User queries whether a specific modifier‑22 (unusual procedural service) is permissible for a given diagnosis under the insurer; the assistant checks policy allowances.
